alert.note: Alert for Hancock (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 13 at 2:47PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Hancock County through 330 PM CDT... At 247 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over West Point, or 12 miles south of Carthage, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bowen and Augusta. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
